CatDescriptText: Mr. Gary Roberts, 409 Market Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, eg. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "It depends on the situation. If she is equipped financially, I would say yes.  It also depends on whether or not she is looking for a companion for the rest of her life."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gary Roberts, wearing striped shirt and zippered jacket, standing with left hand resting on abdomen, in front of sign that reads "Metropolitan Parking Corp. Day Rates Effective Feb. 1, 1958 1 Hour... 50c, 1 to 3 hours 75c, 3 to 5 1.00, 5 to 6 1.25, 8 A.M. to 6... 1.50" and thermometer that reads "Kentucky Club", man standing in background
